alert.note: Alert for Clarke (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:28PM CDT until June 10 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLARKE COUNTY... At 228 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sykes to 7 miles southeast of De Soto, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Crandall around 240 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Shubuta. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
